title: Esther's Bold Petition
shortSummary: In this pivotal chapter, Queen Esther courageously reveals Haman's plot to annihilate her people before King Ahasuerus, leading to Haman's downfall. The chapter highlights divine providence and the triumph of righteousness through faith and boldness.
timeline: c. 5th century BC - Persian Empire under King Ahasuerus

keyCharacters.name: Esther
keyCharacters.description: The Jewish queen who bravely intercedes for her people by revealing Haman's evil plot to the king.

keyCharacters.name: King Ahasuerus
keyCharacters.description: The Persian king who hosts the banquet and ultimately delivers justice by punishing Haman.

keyCharacters.name: Haman
keyCharacters.description: The wicked advisor who plots to destroy the Jews but is exposed and executed.

keyCharacters.name: Harbonah
keyCharacters.description: One of the king's chamberlains who informs the king about the gallows Haman prepared for Mordecai.

definitions.definition: A formal request or plea made to a person in authority, here referring to Esther’s appeal to the king.
A wooden structure used for execution by hanging, symbolizing judgment and justice.
Servants or slaves; Esther contrasts this fate with the destruction planned for her people.
A phrase indicating the granting of a very large or generous request, showing the king’s favor.

outline.heading: The Banquet and Esther’s Bold Request
outline.description: At the second banquet, Esther courageously petitions the king to spare her life and her people, revealing the grave threat they face. This moment underscores the power of faith and courage in confronting evil.

outline.heading: The King’s Inquiry and Haman’s Exposure
outline.description: King Ahasuerus demands to know the identity of the enemy, and Esther reveals Haman as the adversary, causing fear to fall upon him. This reveals God’s providential timing in exposing wickedness.

outline.heading: Haman’s Downfall and Execution
outline.description: The king’s wrath leads to Haman’s attempted plea for mercy, but when he is found threatening the queen, he is sentenced to hang on the gallows he prepared for Mordecai. Justice is served, and the king’s anger is appeased.

application: Trust God’s providence to work through difficult circumstances, even when the outcome seems uncertain.
Be bold and faithful in prayer and intercession, standing up for righteousness and the vulnerable.
Recognize that God can turn the plans of the wicked to bring about justice and deliverance.
Respond to God’s timing with courage, knowing He honors those who act in faith.

keyVerses.text: Then Esther the queen answered and said, If I have found favour in thy sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request:
keyVerses.significance: Esther’s bold and humble appeal exemplifies faith and courage in seeking God’s deliverance through prayer and action.

keyVerses.text: And Esther said, The adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman. Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.
keyVerses.significance: The exposure of Haman’s wickedness marks the turning point where evil is confronted and fear of God’s justice begins to prevail.

keyVerses.text: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
keyVerses.significance: Divine justice is fulfilled as Haman suffers the fate he intended for others, illustrating the principle that evil plans ultimately fail.
